organic_results.title: Education and adaptive capacity
organic_results.snippet: Drawing on evolutionary theory, adaptive capacity is defined in terms of those characteristics which maximize variation and selective retention in individuals and social systems. Utilizing a wide range of concepts which have appeared in the psychological and sociological literature, this paper seeks to identify the major components of variation and selective retention in the adaptive functioning of individuals. In addition, it examines the relationship between education and each of the components of individual adaptive capacity. Finally …
